conclusion: A cast shadow always lies on the straight line that joins 'object → ground point → light source'.
When the lamp is displaced horizontally, the shadow moves in the opposite horizontal direction.

When the lamp is moved from 'in front of the objects' to 'behind the objects', every shadow migrates toward the observer (i.e., toward the bottom of the picture) and becomes a little longer, because the light-to-object horizontal separation is larger while the height of the lamp stays the same.

How much the shadow grows depends on the height of the object: tall objects (alarm-clock, egg carton) lengthen more than the small cuboid; the ball keeps roughly the same diameter but becomes an ellipse with a larger major axis.

When the lamp is shifted to the back-left of the group, the left component of the lamp causes shadows to slide to the right, and the back component causes shadows to slide toward the front edge of the slab (downward in the photo).

When the lamp is shifted to the back-left of the group, all four shadows lengthen a little; the clock’s shadow A and the carton’s shadow D lengthen the most, the cuboid’s C lengthens moderately, and the ball’s B changes from a nearly circular spot into a slightly larger, right-leaning ellipse.
Shadow A (alarm-clock) moves down-right and becomes a longer, right-leaning oval.
Shadow B (ball) moves down-right, keeps its soft outline but becomes an ellipse approximately 10–20% longer than now.
Shadow C (small cuboid) moves down-right, and the rectangle stretches mainly in its long dimension.
Shadow D (egg carton) moves down-right, and the diagonal of the projected trapezoid increases the most.

When the lamp is shifted to the back-right of the group, the right component of the lamp causes shadows to slide to the left, and the back component causes shadows to slide toward the front edge of the slab (downward).

When the lamp is shifted to the back-right of the group, all four shadows lengthen a little; the clock’s shadow A and the carton’s shadow D lengthen the most, the cuboid’s C lengthens moderately, and the ball’s B changes from a nearly circular spot into a slightly larger, left-leaning ellipse.
Shadow A (alarm-clock) moves down-left and becomes a longer, left-leaning oval.
Shadow B (ball) moves down-left and becomes a slightly larger ellipse elongated to the left.
Shadow C (small cuboid) moves down-left, and the rectangle stretches in its long dimension.
Shadow D (egg carton) moves down-left, and its projected trapezoid becomes noticeably longer.
